newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan money market rates dip on low borrowing.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan money market rates dip on low borrowing.

text.p: Pakistan's money market rates dipped to close at seven percent on Friday owing to a lack of borrowing interest, dealers said.
Although some deals were done at 13 percent in the morning, the rates slipped sharply to seven percent before the close, one dealer at Standard Chartered Bank said.
Borrowers squared their positions before the close, the dealer said.
The rates are likely to remain at low levels on Saturday, the dealer said.
